projects.title: AI Chatbot Example
projects.description: An AI-driven chatbot built using natural language processing techniques.

name: Python
description: Experience with basic Python programming concepts, including data structures, functions, and object-oriented programming. I've also have some knowledge with AI Python libraries for such as Tensorflow, Pandas or langchain. An AI engineer will still be more efficient, but I sure can understand his issues.

name: Prompt Engineering
description: I've managed a few projects involving crafting and refining prompts for genAI for my last internship, on top of following Prompt Engineering classes at Coursera. I've also been limit testing the models (mostly OpenAI ones) with almost every task that has been assigned to me since Novemeber 2022

name: ML
description: To complete my cursus, I wanted to dig deeper on the technical side of AI, particalarly what has been done before the Transformers/genAI revolution. To do so, I spent 20-25h studying a handbook of AI's: 'Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach', recommeded to me by Thomas Winters (Post-Doctoral Researcher at KU Leuven, CS department). I've used this time to complete a hadnful of projects to apply what I've learned. Again the idea is to be able to understand a Data Scientist/AI engineer perspective, not replace them.

name: 2nd Brain
description: I trying to gather all the knowledge I've gatherred so far in 'second brain' in Obsidian. I've always been interested in gathering everything in one place

name: UX
description: UX is an important aspect of my master degree. I've been a UX leader, as one of my 3 roles in my stay at Procter&Gamble, and I've worked fully as a UX designer/researcher at Pixminds. I have a strong understanding of the key concepts of UX and how to apply them.

name: Research Methodology
description: I developed strong research methodology skills during my Master’s in Cognitive Science, particularly through my master’s thesis, where I learn to do a litterature review, develop a testing protocol, as well as experiment design. Overall I have a good understanding of the research process, and where to find information in the scientific literature.

name: Cognitive science & Neurosciences
description: From my bachelor in psychology and my master degree, I've aquired strong knowledge in the functions of the brain, its neuroanatamy and its liminations.

name: Soft Skills
description: Coming both from my personality and training in psychology. I've developed strong interpersonal skills, such as active listening, empathy and caring. I'm still learning to better communicate (but honestly, who shouldn't ?). I'm also a teamplayer, I'll raise a concern if I believe the team overlooked it, and I can let go of my opinion if the team agree on another one.  Overall, the team success matters more than my own.
